title: DNA Reveals Cats in Ancient China Were a Different Species Altogether
description: The Best in Science News and Amazing Breakthroughs

title: Ancient China’s Labubu-like doll craze also saw fans splurge silly money on the toys
description: You must have seen Labubu dolls – those furry, razor-toothed monsters that come in an array of colours and hang from every third person’s bag – though perhaps you do so less frequently now than in 2024.I suppose they are cute, a momentary distraction from the fraught world we live in, but for many, these charming critters serve another, humourless purpose: they are investments.Rare or limited-edition Labubus have commanded prices 10 to 20 times their original retail value.Their manufacturer,...

title: An exhibition at CSMVS showcases India’s place in ancient world civilizations
description: The exhibition titled Networks of the Past: A Study Gallery of India and the Ancient World, trains its lens to the duration between the Harappan civilisation — which began roughly 5000 years ago — and the Gupta Empire in the 6th century CE

title: Big fossil fuel companies are responsible for climate crisis but poor countries like Sri Lanka are battered by it – Greenpeace South Asia
description: Greenpeace South Asia yesterday sounded a renewed alarm after a rapid analysis by World Weather Attribution (WWA) confirmed that human-induced climate change significantly intensified the extreme rainfall that battered Sri Lanka during Cyclone Ditwah and fuelled severe flooding across the Malacca Strait. Greenpeace South Asia said that according to the study, the five-day rainfall extremes, [...]

title: Bhagavad Gita Chapter 2: Ancient Wisdom For Modern Uncertainty
description: Following last time’s reflections on the contemporary relevance of the Bhagavad Gita, it feels natural to turn to Chapter 2, which condenses the essence of the Gita into one powerful conversation.
